search_information.query_displayed: Women in Seminary: Dilemmas of Professional Socialization. Kleinman, Sherryl Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Women in seminary: Dilemmas of professional socialization
organic_results.snippet: Professional schools often transmit messages to their female students that make them feel uncomfortable. This article examines the effects on female ministry students of a theology program that has an ideology and professional role intended to be inclusive of women. Although the female students valued the ideology, they found it of little use in legitimating themselves to clients, in demonstrating their professional commitment to church hiring committees, or in working out their plans to have a family and a career.

publication_info.summary: S Kleinman - Sociology of Education, 1984 - JSTOR
